forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 15 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the atmosphere carries the palpable scent of rain mingled with an invigorating hint of salt from the nearby bay. The skies above are marbled with patches of grey clouds that dare to part, revealing fleeting moments of sunshine. Though the thermometer hints at a high of 56 degrees, a steady west wind dances through the streets, whispering of cooler temperatures that soon settle in around 54. With a 70% chance of rain looming, it is prudent for city dwellers to carry an umbrella hidden away beneath their coats—a gentle reminder of the whims of San Francisco’s weather.

As the day transitions into evening, the clouds will continue their lingering presence, though a slight chance of rain offers the possibility of a quieter night. The chill will descend further, nudging close to a low of 48 degrees, urging residents to reach for warmer layers. It is not a day for long strolls or spontaneous picnics by the waterfront; rather, perhaps a quiet afternoon in a snug café, sipping a warm brew, as the clouds keep their watchful eye on the city skyline, might be the best pursuit. Enjoy the spectacle of this dynamic weather while savoring a moment of contemplation, wrapped in the comfort of a good book or the company of friends, as the city continues to breathe through its inimitable charm.
